shapes3d.utils
Class VCam

java.lang.Object
  shapes3d.utils.VCam
Direct Known Subclasses:
TerrainCam
public class VCam
extends java.lang.Object

This class will become the basis for a range of camera types, but is not fully implemented at the moment. I intend to provide a generic set of movement and rotation methods based on the apache commons maths project.

Author:
Peter Lager

Constructor Detail

VCam

public VCam(PApplet app)
Creates a perspective camera. The default values are:
perspective(fov, aspectRatio, nearZ, farZ)
fov = PI/3
aspectRatio = width/height
nearZ = cameraZ / 1000000.0f
farZ = cameraZ*10.0f
where cameraZ is ((height/2.0) / tan(fov/2.0))
The nearZ value is much smaller than the default value in Processing to make sure the terrain is drawn right up to the camera position.

Parameters:
app -
Method Detail

perspective

public void perspective()
Sets the perspective to be used for the display. Useful if we have multiple with different perspective values.

Set the camera position ready for drawing. Equivalent to camera() function in Processing
